member.name: P:NFX.Serialization.Slim.ISlimSerializer.TypeMode
member.summary: Gets/sets how serializer handles type information between calls to Serialize/Deserialize. This property itself is not thread-safe, that is - it should be only set once by control/initiating thread

member.name: P:NFX.Serialization.Slim.ISlimSerializer.BatchTypesAdded
member.summary: Returns true if last call to Serialize or Deserialize in batch mode added more types to type registry. This call is only valid in TypeMode = "Batch" and is inherently not thread-safe

member.name: T:NFX.Serialization.Slim.PODSlimSerializer
member.summary: Serializes CLR object graphs using PortableObjectDocument container and Slim binary serialization algorithm. This class is far less performant than SlimSerializer, however it serializes types using document model that allows to transform/change data during serialization/deserialization. This class is needed for upgrades, when object metadata may change but need to be read (maybe partially) back into the new type structure

member.name: T:NFX.Serialization.Slim.SlimSerializer
member.summary: Implements Slim serialization algorithm that relies on an injectable SlimFormat-derivative (through .ctor) paremeter. This class was designed for highly-efficient serialization of types without versioning. SlimSerializer supports a concept of "known types" that save space by not emitting their names into stream. Performance note: This serializer yields on average 1/4 serialization and 1/2 deserialization times while compared to BinaryFormatter. Serialization of Record-instances usually takes 1/6 of BinaryFormatter time. Format takes 1/10 space for records and 1/2 for general object graphs. Such performance is achieved because of dynamic compilation of type-specific serialization/deserialization methods. This type is thread-safe for serializations/deserializations when TypeMode is set to "PerCall"

member.name: F:NFX.Serialization.Slim.SlimSerializer.Owner
member.summary: Associates arbitrary owner object with this instance. Slim serializer does not use this field internally for any purpose

member.name: M:NFX.Serialization.Slim.SlimSerializer.ResetCallBatch
member.summary: Resets type registry to initial state (which is based on global types) for TypeMode = "Batch", otherwise does nothing. This method is not thread-safe

member.name: P:NFX.Serialization.Slim.SlimSerializer.TypeMode
member.summary: Gets/sets how serializer handles type information between calls to Serialize/Deserialize. Setting this to "Batch" makes this serializer instance not thread-safe for calling Serialize/Deserialize. This property itself is not thread-safe, that is - it should be only set once by control/initiating thread

member.name: P:NFX.Serialization.Slim.SlimSerializer.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Returns true when TypeMode is "PerCall"

member.name: P:NFX.Serialization.Slim.SlimSerializer.BatchTypesAdded

example.code:
# # #[class] public string Title { get {return "aaaaa"; } } protected abstract void renderHeader(); protected abstract void renderBody(bool showDetails); protected abstract void renderFooter(); #[render] ?[Title]

This is Header

@[renderHeader();]

This is Body

@[renderBody(true);]

This is in master page

This is Footer

@[renderFooter();]

member.name: T:NFX.Throttling.SlidingWindowThrottle
member.summary: Efficiently calculates the throttling rate over a number of seconds. The algorithm implements a variation of token bucket algorithm that doesn't require to add tokens to the bucket on a timer but rather it maintains a cirtular buffer of tokens with resolution of 1/BucketsPerSec. The Add() function is used to add items to a bucket associated with the timestamp passed as the first argument to the function. The Sum() returns the total number of items over the given interval of seconds. The items automatically expire when the time moves on the successive invocations of the Add() method.

member.name: M:NFX.Throttling.SlidingWindowThrottle.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Name of this instance
Throttling limit per throttleInterval
Throttling interval in number of seconds
Number of buckets per second to calculate internal running sum. The greater the value the more precise the avg calculation is and the longer it takes to calculate
Unit of measurement

member.summary: Reset the internal state of the throttling strategy

member.summary: Dump the internal state to string
member.param: Time for which to dump internal state to string

member.summary: Add value to the bucket associated with time
member.param: Monotonically increasing time value
The value to add to the bucket associated with time
member.returns: Current running sum

member.summary: Return throttle limit over Interval

member.summary: Return throttling interval in seconds
